Site Education Manager – Corrections Victoria (Geelong area)

Company Name Box Hill Institute Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Located at Marngoneet Correctional Centre in Lara (10 minutes from Geelong)
  • Full time, fixed term contract to December 2020
  • $88,305 (SE1) per annum plus compulsory superannuation


About The Role

This role is based at a prison in Lara and involves direct contact with prisoners (students). Marngoneet Correctional Centre is a medium security prison and there is an expectation that the incumbent work at other correctional sites in the region, as and if required.

We are looking for an individual who is ready to step into this role with a willingness to make a difference. You will join our friendly and professional team, in a challenging yet rewarding environment where you will make a positive and meaningful social impact through Education.

The role of the Site Education Manager is to ensure the successful development and delivery of high quality Nationally Recognised Training programs to the Corrections Victoria (CV) prisons. The Site Education Manager will focus on the provision of professional and client centric teaching and learning through educational leadership, operational management and building strong collaborative relationships with teaching and professional employees, stakeholders and local communities within the designated site(s).

The Site Education Manager is a member of the Contracted Delivery team within the Business Growth and Diversification division. The Corrections Victoria Project as part of the Contracted Delivery team provides accredited Education/Industry based programs in a number of Victorian Prisons.

Your Skills And Experience

  • A Certificate IV in Training and Assessment is essential
    • A tertiary qualification in Business Management, Education or equivalent
    Program Delivery: Demonstrated experience in an operational management role within a related sector and managing a team of teaching and professional staff in the delivery of high quality academic programs, along with the ability to maintain business and industry partnerships.
    Vocational Expertise: Experience within the education and training sector. Highly developed understanding of the full range of applied teaching methodologies, techniques and standards appropriate to adult learning.
    Resource Management: Demonstrated experience in managing and monitoring budgets, financial reporting, along with compliance management and administration, managing and negotiating physical, human and financial resources.
    Delivery of Results: Proven outcomes in delivering results in line with project timelines and budget and accountability in meeting client set project KPIs.
  • Stakeholder Management: Identifies and manages a range of complex and competing needs, identifies mutually beneficial partnerships and finds innovative solutions to resolve stakeholder issues.

    Like to know more? If you have questions about this role, please contact Jamie Crouch at j.crouch@boxhill.edu.au or by phone on 03 5220 8223.

    Applications close: 9am, Friday 19 October 2018
    Please note: The Box Hill Institute Group reserves the right to withdraw an advertised position at any stage.
    You will need to provide a current National Police Records Check and an Employee category Working with Children Check. You will also need to provide evidence of your entitlement to work in Australia and certified copies of your qualifications.

[

Data Manager

Company Name Medpace Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 20 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Data Manager

Permanent


Location:\xa0Melbourne, Australia\xa0


Salary: Competitive, plus generous benefits package


Overview

Medpace is a scientifically-driven, global, full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO) providing Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Medpace’s mission is to accelerate the global development of safe and effective medical therapeutics through its high-science and disciplined operating approach. We leverage local regulatory and deep therapeutic expertise across all major areas including oncology, cardiology, metabolic disease, endocrinology, central nervous system, anti-viral and anti-infective. Headquartered in Cincinnati, Ohio, Medpace employs approximately 2,700 people across 36 countries.

Job Summary

Our clinical activities are growing rapidly, and we are currently seeking a full-time, office-based Data Manager to join our Biometrics team. This position is fully office based and you will work with local and international teams and will manage global studies and be involved in developing the data management team in Australia, Melbourne. If you want an exciting career where you use your previous expertise and can develop and grow your career even further, then this is the opportunity for you.

Responsibilities

  • Manage multiple projects from a data management perspective;
  • Develop and review ECRFs, Edit Check Specifications, Data Management Plans, Data Transfer Agreements etc. for clinical trials with sponsor companies and other departments;
  • Coordinate overall data management by serving as primary contact for the sponsor;
  • Interact with external data providers, and all project team members in the cross functional team; and
  • Attend bid defence meetings and face to face sponsor meetings.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree and at least 7 years of Data Management experience; including setting up and managing multiple clinical projects and acting as the main point of contact for the sponsor;
  • Computer experience with EDC databases and analysis software;
  • Possess an understanding of database structure and computer storage in data management; and
  • A basic knowledge of medical terminology is needed, as well as knowledge of a scientific investigative methodologies and clinical research methodologies.

Why Medpace?

When you join Medpace, you become part of a team dedicated to supporting the development of ground breaking drugs and devices. Our employees provide hope for those living with debilitating diseases. We invite you to be a part of something that is impacting millions of people around the globe while enjoying a competitive total compensation and benefits package and internal growth opportunities.

Awards
  • Medpace Named a Top Cincinnati Workplace for 2015, 2016, 2017 and 2018 by the Cincinnati Enquirer
  • Winner of the ACRP-Avoca CRO Quality Award in 2018
  • Recognized with six CRO Leadership Awards from Life Science Leader magazine
  • Eagle Award winner - which recognizes outstanding leadership, professionalism, integrity, and dedication to advancing the clinical research profession through strong site partnerships

What To Expect Next

We look forward to receiving your application. A member of our recruitment team will review your qualifications and if interested, you will be contacted for an interview.

EO/AA Employer M/F/Disability/Vets

  • WARNING: Please beware of phishing scams that offer opportunities with Medpace in exchange for sending money. These scammers pose as legitimate employees from actual companies. Please be advised that a Medpace employee will never ask you for a credit card, send you a check, or ask you for any type of payment as part of consideration for a role with our company. All of our careers require that you first complete an online application and go through some sort of interview process.

ITS Domain Lead

Company Name Transurban Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • 727 Collins Street
  • Permanent Full Time


The work our ITS teams do today will change how we travel tomorrow by delivering safer, more sustainable travel. As the ITS Domain Lead you will be responsible for supporting alignment of the business needs and strategies with the ITS solutions capability across a 1-10 year time horizon. Domains that you will work across include Traffic Network and Control Systems, Roadside Tolling Solutions and Motorway Network Control Systems.

Our world-leading Intelligent Transport Systems teams support the creation of roads for the future. They make toll collections automated and easy. They deliver advanced control systems that monitor and manage traffic on the road – that can detect traffic incidents, and even predict when an accident is more likely to happen. They make roads ready for driverless cars, and co-ordinate smart traffic flow to get us where we’re going faster. A career here makes a difference.

The impact you’ll have
  • You'll research and present how ITS systems will look in 15 years time
  • You’ll provide technical expertise in ITS Domain subject matter from planning through to implementation
  • You’ll work closely with ITS Engineering Managers and Architects to ensure smooth delivery of designs that are aligned to the ITS domain blueprint
  • You’ll manage engagement between ITS engineering and roads asset managers to deliver the best outcome
  • You’ll work in partnership with ITS Vendors

The talents you’ll bring
  • A degree-qualified, professionally accredited engineer, you’ll have significant professional experience and a hands-on understanding of ITS engineering or a suitably transferable discipline gained within a complex, matrix organisation
  • You’ll be a sound communicator, including verbal communication skills, presentations, report writing and the preparation of concise management reports
  • Ideally you’ll have consulting experience with proven ability to solve complex problems and link from operational matters to strategic impacts
  • You’ll come with proven experience working with senior business stakeholders to achieve successful business outcomes
  • You’ll be able to demonstrate strong customer focus and a team player willing to apply initiative in the work environment

The rewards you’ll earn
  • We’ll make sure you have the tools you need to work smart and live better – including remote & flexible working.
  • We’ll develop you the way you want, with study assistance, training and career planning.
  • We’ll offer flexible leave, public transport ticket purchasing programs, insurance and salary continuance.
  • We’ll help you be healthy with flu vaccinations, fitness classes, fresh fruit and mental health support.
  • We’ll invite you to plenty of social activities, including ones that give back to our communities.


About Us

Transurban is driven by bringing people and places closer. The roads we plan, build, operate and maintain make communities stronger, across Australia and beyond. Together, we’re building a future that marries traditional infrastructure with emerging technology. We’re making roads ready for driverless cars and predicting accidents before they happen. We’re getting people where they’re going. And we’re doing it faster, smarter and safer, every last one of us.

Start changing the world around you. Click Apply now

903606191:
[

[Freelancer] Airbnb Experiences Ambassador, Melbourne

Company Name Airbnb Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 7 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Founded in August of 2008 and based in San Francisco, California, Airbnb is a trusted community marketplace for people to list, discover, and book unique travel experiences around the world. Whether an apartment for a night, a castle for a week, or a villa for a month, Airbnb allows people to Belong Anywhere through unique travel experiences at any price point, in more than 34,000 cities and over 191 countries. We promote a culture of curiosity, humanity, and creativity through our product, brand, and, most importantly, our people.

Airbnb Experiences are excursions, or other activities curated by Airbnb, designed and led by local hosts who give guests unique access into places and communities in their city. Guests can already book a wide variety of Experiences in Asia Pacific, such as making soup dumplings in Shanghai with a local expert and taking surfing lessons with passionate surfers in Bali.

We’re looking for amazing Ambassadors for Airbnb Experiences that can help us create a large number of entrepreneurs in Asia Pacific. You will be working as an independent freelancer for Airbnb, and earn a fixed referral fee for every Experience listing you generate that obtains a booking on the platform.

As an Airbnb Experiences Ambassador, you will find new Experience hosts for the platform. You must be living in the city you want to become an Ambassador for, and have your finger on the pulse of your city.

Airbnb Experience Ambassadors Should Be
  • Knowledgeable: You know about Airbnb Experiences, and can explain how awesome it is to others! Bonus points if you’re already a host on Airbnb
  • Self-Starters: Able to create a plan of action and execute it
  • Promoters: Skilled at talking to others and promoting great products like Airbnb Experiences
  • Great communicators: Able to communicate quickly, effectively and accurately to various audiences
  • Fast learners: Comfortable with a fast-paced environment and changing requirements. Startup experience a plus
  • Independent: Ability to flourish with minimal guidance and be proactive

What do Airbnb Experience Ambassadors do?
  • Use your creativity and initiative to grow our Experience host community in Asia Pacific
  • Identify local initiatives and projects
  • Identify potential leads in market, through online and offline sources, and help the team in their Experience host outreach
  • Create and manage community events to spread the word about Airbnb Experiences

What do you get out of this?
  • Empower a generation of entrepreneurs to share their passions with the world on the Experiences platform
  • You’ll learn about marketing, sales, business development and community building at a local level with the help of our Trips & Experiences team in Asia Pacific


The Details
  • You’ll work as an independent freelancer for Airbnb.
  • You’ll receive a fixed referral fee for each new Airbnb Experience listing you generate that obtains a booking on the platform.
  • As an Airbnb Experience Ambassador, you are acting as an independent freelancer, and not on behalf of Airbnb.
  • You must live in your city full-time, and have the necessary work authorization. Airbnb will not be able to provide any work sponsorship for this role.

Industry

  • Internet
  • Leisure, Travel & Tourism

Origin - Australia's Leading Integrated Energy Company

An integral part of Australia’s energy future, we explore, produce, generate and sell energy to power millions of Australian homes and businesses every day, keeping them going and growing.

The Role

Origin offers exciting and rewarding career opportunities – from project management and leadership, to technical and engineering. Working for Origin can take you all over Australia - in the field, as well as in the office – or around the world. With global energy demand growing, Origin is looking for new ways to meet that need and create tomorrow's energy solutions. It is an exciting time to be a part of Origin.

One in three Australians will need blood or blood products in their lifetime. At the Australian Red Cross Blood Service, we’re entrusted with collecting, processing and delivering this vital supply. We also provide a range of other services to the healthcare sector related to transplantation and immunogenetics, testing, consulting, education and research.

We’re proudly in the business of saving lives. Working with the broader OD and Learning team, as a Senior OD Consultant, you will play a lead role in advancing our employee experience agenda, including working on our employee engagement survey. You will explore human centred design thinking to further inform our people and culture priorities in areas such as diversity & inclusion.

This role will require you to build strong and influential relationships with a wide range of stakeholders internally and externally. You will be energetic and dynamic, able to work at a fast pace to deliver on priorities to a high level of quality. You will be skilled at applying OD principles and frameworks in a commercial context to meet business requirements.

You Will Have

  • Broad organisation development experience
  • Coverage across employee engagement as well as diversity & inclusion portfolios
  • Experience in designing innovative OD solutions in complex business environments
  • Strong commercial focus and ability to align initiatives to clear business priorities
  • Proven track record in leading end to end OD projects
  • Commitment to making things simple and fit for purpose
  • Tertiary qualification in relevant field.

    • Your Dedication And Hard Work Will Be Rewarded With

  • Pride that your work will impact lives for the better
  • Generous salary packaging benefits
  • Corporate rates for private health insurance

    • As part of the recruitment process, you may be required to participate in relevant National Police, Employment History and/or Professional Membership and Qualification checks and validation of Australian Work Rights, prior to offer of employment at the Blood Service.

    The Blood Service is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application.

    For further details on this position please contact Jono Greensides on 03 9863 1739

    Applications for this role close Friday 12th October 2018 @ 5:00pm

    Whilst we appreciate all interest in our business, we regret to inform that we will not be engaging with, or accepting candidates from agencies or consulting firms on this occasion.

    • Management Consulting
    • Nonprofit Organization Management

Vision Australia is a leading national provider of blindness and low vision services in Australia. We work in partnership with Australians who are blind or have low vision to help them achieve the possibilities they choose in life.

We support more than 27,500 people of all ages and life stages, and circumstances. We do this through 28 Vision Australia centres in Victoria, New South Wales, the Australian Capital Territory, Queensland, South Australia and Western Australia; 30 clinics; and through outreach programs in the Northern Territory and Tasmania.

Responsibilities

As aTest Analyst at Vision Australia you will:
  • Complete system testing activities within the Software Development Life Cycle context;
  • Analyse business requirements documentation(s) and user stories to determine testing requirements for software/application releases, primarily across Salesforce, Skedulo, NetSuite and Mulesoft platforms;
  • With the support of the lead Test Analyst, review user stories, engage PM’s, BA’s, Developers, and other stakeholders to prepare and coordinate the delivery of testing documentation particularly test plans, test cases and test summary reports;

Location: Melbourne Metropolitan
Work Type: Permanent - Full Time (EBA)

The role

We currently have an opportunity for an experienced Multi Combination Driver to work out of our Campbellfield sites.

Working across a 7 day roster, you will be responsible for the loading and delivery of cement to multiple sites as well as general yard and plant housekeeping.

If you have a minimum of 12 months experience driving a multi / heavy combination vehicle, we will train you in all areas required to become a competent Tanker Driver.

We are offering a competitive hourly rate and opportunities for regular paid overtime as part of a team where your contribution will be valued. To be successful in this role you will need to be customer focused and have the ability to prioritise your work and be committed to safety and continuous improvement.

Responsibilities
  • Ensure safety, health and environment standards are maintained
  • Work a roster which falls across a 7 day work week
  • Understands Chain of Responsibility (COR), fatigue management and mass management

  • Maintain the vehicle in a clean and tidy condition
  • Undertake general yard duties and plant housekeeping

  • A reliable team player attitude with a focus on customer service
  • Flexibility to work in a small team environment and assist with other duties as required

Our business

Central Pre-Mix Concrete is an integrated concrete and aggregate operation with five concrete plants and a hard rock aggregate quarry serving the metropolitan Melbourne market. Our modern high capacity batch plants are located at Deer Park, Campbellfield, Hallam, Port Melbourne and Gisborne and we operate a fleet of agitator trucks and an aggregate and cement cartage fleet.

Central Pre-Mix Concrete is a subsidiary of Adelaide Brighton Limited, a leading Australian construction materials company with operations that comprise cement and lime, concrete and aggregates and concrete products and employs 1,500 people nationally.

Open to new ideas and experiences; Handles situations and problems with innovation and creativity; Thinks broadly and strategically; Shows fresh, insightful thinking by producing a range of creative solutions and approaches to problems.

Delivering Results and Meeting Customer Expectations

Drives improvements for business results; creates a culture of discipline by consistently setting high standards for quality and quantity at all times; monitors and maintains productivity; uses economic, financial, market and industry data to understand and improve business results.

Relating and Networking

Creates win-win partnerships by building effective relationships; the team and cross functionally; collaborates and relates well to people at all levels; manages conflict promptly and effectively and builds trust by connecting, understanding differences and empathising with others.

Responsibilities
  • In collaboration with the Design team, assist in the further development of packaging solutions from approved concept through to production with a focus on innovation
  • Work with the Design team to prepare cost estimates on packaging and printing options during concept development while ensuring all packaging dimensions are estimated accurately to enable retail partners to set planograms
  • Provide packaging design and engineering direction and technical support to the product development team, including guidance regarding concept feasibility, cost considerations, general product manufacturing and assembly recommendations
  • Analyse packaging designs to optimise the utilization of materials as well as manufacturing, assembly methods and production processes in order to meet cost objectives, quality and transit testing specifications
  • Ensure packaging concepts are feasible in large scale manufacturing environment and are delivered within budget
  • Work to develop packaging guidelines in line with APC regulations
  • Contribute to the development of “Frustration Free Packaging”
  • Research and present new package design trends, technologies, materials, and manufacturing processes.
  • Build and maintain packaging library and ensure all conceptual packaging concepts, approved packaging die-lines and blister specs are documented and filed future use
  • Design and creation of inside packaging components, including blisters and component layout
  • Creation of "Product Packing Instructions" documents to clearly communicate internally to the Global organisation and externally with production partners.
  • Prepare and maintain product specification for all In-Store Display units, including FSDU, Shelf Ready PDQ, Sidekick, Endcap, and Shelf Pallets
  • Design from concept to production including engineering analysis, testing, design, tooling recommendations, prototype build, safety approvals and product integration
  • Develop and check technical documentation, engineering drawings and assembly diagrams to ensure that necessary information for manufacturing and assembly is clearly communicated
  • Interface with manufacturers to resolve technical issues that may arise in manufacturing and to improve cost and quality of designs
  • Participate in design reviews, risk assessments and continual improvement planning
  • Provide training to other personnel to improve overall capabilities and knowledge

#LI
  • A tertiary qualification in Packaging Engineering, Product Design, Engineering, Industrial Design or similar
  • 8+ years of packaging design and engineering experience (concept to production), including costing, testing and manufacturing
  • Toy industry or FMCG experience is valuable but not essential.

903620427:
[

General Surgical Fellow 2019

Company Name Northern Health Company Location Epping, AU

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

Northern Health provides a diverse range of acute, sub-acute and community health services to the large and diverse population in the regions north of Melbourne.

There are five campuses; Broadmeadows Hospital, Bundoora Extended Care Centre, The Northern Hospital at Epping, PANCH Health Service at Preston, and Craigieburn Health Service. Broadmeadows Hospital (BH) (previously known as Broadmeadows Health Service BHS) is increasingly admitting more complex patients in Medicine and Surgery.

During 2016, Broadmeadows Hospital theatre complex underwent an upgrade. The theatre complex now consists of four theatres, two endoscopy suites, a new CSSD, a first and second stage recovery area and a new admissions area. The surgical ward manages overnight and multi-day surgical cases in the specialities of general surgery, gynaecology, ENT, vascular surgery, plastic surgery, urology and orthopaedic surgery. Outpatient facilities have also been upgraded to allow for the increasing pre and post-operative workload.

General Surgery Department

The Department Of General Surgery Comprises Of Five Units
  • Surgical Unit 1 Colorectal
  • Surgical Unit 2 Breast/Endocrine
  • Surgical Unit 3 Endocrine/Upper Gastro-Intestinal
  • Surgical Unit 4 Upper Gastro-Intestinal/Hepato-Pancreatico-Biliary
  • Acute General Surgery Unit (AGSU)

Surgical Units 1-4 are elective units while AGSU is the emergency on-call unit, however, the surgeons and the fellows attached to Surgical Units 1 – 4 all share the on-call AGSU roster. All five surgical units have their own accredited registrars, non-accredited registrars (AGSU only) and interns.

All units work across all Northern Health campuses with the Northern Hospital being the principle emergency and elective campus and Broadmeadows Hospital being the elective campus.

In 2019, NH will employ to four General Surgery Fellow positions across each of the General Surgical Units 1-4. Fellows will be asked to nominate any special interest at the time of application

Northern Health is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce which reflects the community we serve. Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged.

NLi*

  • Hospital & Health Care

Senior HR Advisory Consultant (part-time)

Company Name Coles Company Location Hawthorn East, AU

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The role

Based in our Store Support Centre at Hawthorn East, the Coles HR Advisory Services team has an exciting opportunity for an experienced workplace relations or HR legal professional to join our team. You’ll join a stimulating, supportive and friendly environment where every day is different.

The role provides comprehensive advice and support to line managers across all Coles' businesses including escalations within Victoria, Tasmania and nationally as required. Additionally, you will represent Coles in the early stages of litigation, such as conciliations and conferences in the Fair Work Commission and in equal opportunity tribunals.

To be successful, you’ll have
  • significant experience in managing and resolving complex workplace relations issues, including conducting workplace investigations into alleged breaches of employment policies or legislation
  • experience supporting line managers working with team members with non-work related long term illnesses and injuries
  • advanced written and verbal communication and negotiation skills
  • a strong customer focus
  • proven ability to clearly outline risk and make informed recommendations in a fast paced environment
  • a passion for developing line manager workplace relations capability
  • exposure to the Fair Work Commission
  • relevant tertiary qualifications in Employment Law/Human Resources


Your Key Responsibilities Will Be To
  • Provide end to end case management of a broad range of workplace relations issues including unfair dismissal claims, general protections claims and equal opportunity matters
  • Advise managers in supporting team members with long term, non-work related illness or injury
  • Undertake workplace investigations into potential breaches of employment related legislation
  • Manage the early stages of litigation including unfair dismissal conciliations, general protections conferences and conferences in the equal opportunity commissions, with support from internal legal counsel
  • Assist in developing the workplace relations capability of our team, as well as the workplace relations capability of our stakeholders

Culture

Coles is a fast-paced, constantly changing business that focuses your talents and challenges you to perform at your best.

As a team, we’re bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to transform retail and delight customers.

Benefits

If that isn’t exciting enough, as a team member at Coles you
  • will receive a staff discount and exclusive team member offers
  • can enjoy a convenience store located onsite
  • are able to sample new products and flavours before they hit the shelves
  • have access to a Fitness Centre and Body Therapy Clinic
  • will be part of a fun and inclusive culture where customer, community and team are at the heart of what we do


About Us

Today, Coles is one of Australia’s iconic retailers, providing a range of fresh food, groceries, general merchandise, liquor and fuel to millions of customers every week.

We have a combination of over 2,400 retail outlets across Australia covering Coles supermarkets, Coles Express fuel and convenience sites, Spirit Hotels and liquor stores under Liquorland, Vintage Cellars and First Choice Liquor branding.

While some things have changed over the years, one thing remains the same – our customer first strategy. We have over 112,000 fantastic team members across the country that are focused on making life easier for our customers and making a difference to the communities we serve every day.

Please Note

We prefer to deal with you directly and have not engaged an agency for this role, so if you’re interested, please apply.

At Coles, we aim to ensure our team represents the community we serve, embracing the richness of Australia's diverse population.

This role is eligible for the Team Member Referral Program

  • Retail
